question: During the electrolysis of brine, by using inert electrodes,
explanation: **Anode:** <katex>$Cl^-$</katex> is oxidized to <katex>$Cl_2$</katex> gas. (Although oxidation of water to O2 is possible, Cl2 formation is preferred due to overpotential).
**Cathode:** Water is reduced to <katex>$H_2$</katex> gas (since discharge potential of H+ is lower than Na+).
Result: <katex>$Cl_2$</katex> at anode, <katex>$H_2$</katex> at cathode, NaOH in solution.
